title: Assault charges dropped against Steelers' Anthony Chickillo accused of injuring Olympian girlfriend
text:
Misdemeanor charges have been dropped against a Pittsburgh Steelers player who had been accused of injuring his Olympian girlfriend during a recent fight at a local resort, as both sides have agreed to forgive each other.

Backup linebacker Anthony Chickillo had been charged with simple assault, criminal mischief and harassment after the October 20 fight with Alysha Newman, a Canadian pole vaulter, at Nemacolin Woodlands Resort in western Pennsylvania.

Fayette County District Attorney Richard Bower said Wednesday that the woman, who had previously been identified as Newman, no longer wanted to pursue charges.

'The two individuals involved have indicated that they obviously do not want to go forward, that they wish the best for each other,' Bower told reporters, as quoted by the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette. 'Additionally, they've indicated to me that they have both forgiven each other for what has happened.'

Chickillo had been placed on the NFL's exempt list, preventing him from playing or practicing with the team.

Anthony Chickillo caught by WPXI cameras as he entered the court room in Fayette County Pennsylvania on Wednesday. Chickillo, 26, has been away from the team since being charged

Fayette County District Attorney Richard Bower said Wednesday that the woman, who had previously been identified as Alysha Newman (left), no longer wanted to pursue charges against Steelers linebacker Anthony Chickillo, who had been accused of injuring her

Backup linebacker Anthony Chickillo (left) had been charged with simple assault, criminal mischief and harassment after the October 20 fight with Alysha Newman (right), a Canadian pole vaulter, at Nemacolin Woodlands Resort in western Pennsylvania. Those charges have been dropped, and both parties have told local prosecutors that they've forgiven each other

The 26-year-old backup linebacker was arrested in the early hours of October 20 after police responded to a disturbance at the Nemacolin Woodlands Resort (above) at 1:40am

Police said the pair got into an argument over table games at Lady Luck Casino that later became physical in their hotel room.

According to the initial report, Newman, 25, says Chickillo, 26, grabbed her 'by the biceps and forced her against a wall and door,' leaving her with visible injuries.

He told police that Newman assaulted him first by punching him in the head which prompted the 255-pound Chickillo to push her down to the floor in an attempt to restrain her.

Chickillo told police that Newman assaulted him first by punching him in the head which prompted him to push her down to the floor in an attempt to restrain her

Newman admitted to striking Chickillo in the head but told police it happened only after he threw her to the floor.

When troopers arrived, they said they found redness on Newman's biceps with bruises starting to show.

Newman also told police that Chickillo smashed her $900 iPhone before she locked herself in the bathroom where she waited for police to arrive.

Chickillo was arrested at the scene. He was later released on a $10,000 bail.

Meanwhile Newman was cited for harassment, police said.

Chickillo, a Tampa, Florida resident, has been with the Steelers for five years. He has one tackle and half a sack in three games this season, battling through injuries and playing primarily on special teams.

After competing at the 2016 Olympics, Newman took gold at the 2018 Commonwealth Games, and won bronze at the Pan American Games in Lima earlier this year.
description: Misdemeanor charges have been dropped against Pittsburgh Steelers linebacker Anthony Chickillo, who had been accused of assaulting his girlfriend, a Canadian Olympian, at a resort.
